ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Ability to design and evaluate engineering designs using Solidworks, one of probably 3 primary software used for this purpose in the industry.
Coming from Science, this was my first Engineering course. I liked how we not only learned to use solidworks, but also covered the Background well. Also, I really enjoyed the two MatLab assignments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The professor and TA were great so that is a positive. The professor really knew the software (which is updated each year) and the assignments are thoughtful and well laid out. No real negatives.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would. There are two midterms (each weighted 15%) and 10-12 homeworks and a final project (that includes a presentation). It is work but it is fun work and you get to know how to use Solidworks really well by the end of the class. It is perhaps the closest class to a 'real world engineering application' class that you could take.
